Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that receives plenty of water and is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not receive enough water and is wilting or struggling to grow.
The student can identify and show patterns that healthy plants need water to live and grow through their drawings.
The student can use their drawings to explain that plants cannot live without water, based on the patterns observed.
